body.p: The DefaultElementLocatorProvider implementation is used by default to find link target references. It offers support for the most common types of links:

ul.li: Links based on ID attribute values.

body.p: The method getElementLocator determines what ElementLocator should be used. In the default implementation, it checks if the link is an XPointer element() scheme. Otherwise, it assumes it is an ID. A non-null IDTypeVerifier will always be provided if a schema is associated with the document type.
The link string argument is the anchor part of the of the URL that is composed from the value of the link property specified for the link element in the CSS.
